title: System Architecture & AI Unix Philosophy
description: Foundational principles for designing modular, scalable, and forensic-ready agent systems.

principles.name: Unix Modularity
principles.rule: Each script and JSON artifact should have a singular, clear purpose. Composition over monoliths.
principles.rationale: Modular design prevents cognitive overload and allows for surgical hardening of specific technical nerves.

principles.name: Boomerang Orchestration
principles.rule: Agents must return to the user for steering after significant milestones or deviations.
principles.rationale: The human-in-the-loop is the ultimate driver. The boomerang ensures session velocity remains aligned with strategic goals.

principles.name: Fractal Memory
principles.rule: Knowledge is structured hierarchically, from temporal logs to permanent Heartwood principles.
principles.rationale: Monotonic growth ensures that every session turn contributes to the long-term wisdom of the firm.

principles.name: Eukaryotic Repository Model
principles.rule: Repositories are hybrid 'Subject-within-Object' entities managed by Git and cloud-synced blobs.
principles.rationale: Distinguishing between git-managed logic and synced data layers ensures absolute forensic traceability and low-latency operations.
